messages.content: What are the diffusion tiling algorithms supported by ComfyUI-TiledDiffusion?
The extension supports two SOTA diffusion tiling algorithms: `Mixture of Diffusers` and `MultiDiffusion`.
What are the dimensions in the Features table?
The dimensions shown in the Features table are in pixels and then converted to latent-space sizes.
How can I see the tile seams and then adjust the options to my needs?
Set `tile_overlap` to 0 and `denoise` to 1 to see the tile seams, and then adjust the options accordingly.
What are the benefits of increasing `tile_batch_size`?
Increasing `tile_batch_size` can increase the speed of processing, but your machine must be able to handle it.
Can I use the ComfyUI-TiledDiffusion extension for ultra-large image generation?
Yes, the extension supports ultra-large image generation.
What is the recommended tile size for Tiled VAE?
The recommended tile sizes are given upon the creation of the node based on the available VRAM.
What is the impact of enabling `fast` for the decoder in Tiled VAE?
Enabling `fast` for the decoder may produce images with slightly higher contrast and brightness.
What is the purpose of `color_fix` in Tiled VAE?
`color_fix` can restore colors if tiles are too small. It is only for the encoder.
What is the expected image quality when using `MultiDiffusion` or `Mixture of Diffusers`?
The image quality when using either `MultiDiffusion` or `Mixture of Diffusers` should be as per the SOTA (State of the Art) standards.
Can you provide examples of images that can be loaded in ComfyUI using the ComfyUI-TiledDiffusion extension?
Yes, the following images can be loaded: `Simple upscale.` and `4x upscale. 3 passes.`
